poem:
Title: Life's Threats Undeterred

In law's ironic theatre, threats weave their tales,
Pannun, parade's single soul, sternly regales.
Sikh, yet American, bravely defends,
While India's dark specter ceaselessly sends.
Murderous missives, whispered death's breath,
Scrawlings of doom, hinting silent death.
Against this storm, he stands bereft,
Within life's frail vessel, courage is left.
